segments.pli: “Yasmiṃ, bhikkhave, samaye rājāno adhammikā honti, rājāyuttāpi tasmiṃ samaye adhammikā honti.
segments.en: “At a time when kings are unprincipled, royal officials become unprincipled.

segments.pli: Rājāyuttesu adhammikesu brāhmaṇagahapatikāpi tasmiṃ samaye adhammikā honti.
segments.en: When royal officials are unprincipled, brahmins and householders become unprincipled.

segments.pli: Brāhmaṇagahapatikesu adhammikesu negamajānapadāpi tasmiṃ samaye adhammikā honti.
segments.en: When brahmins and householders are unprincipled, the people of town and country become unprincipled.
When the people of town and country are unprincipled, the courses of the moon and sun become erratic.

segments.pli: Visamaṃ candimasūriyesu parivattantesu visamaṃ nakkhattāni tārakarūpāni parivattanti.
segments.en: … the courses of the stars and constellations …

segments.pli: Visamaṃ nakkhattesu tārakarūpesu parivattantesu visamaṃ rattindivā parivattanti.
Visamaṃ rattindivesu parivattantesu visamaṃ māsaddhamāsā parivattanti.
Visamaṃ māsaddhamāsesu parivattantesu visamaṃ utusaṃvaccharā parivattanti.
segments.en: the seasons and years become erratic.

segments.pli: Visamaṃ utusaṃvaccharesu parivattantesu visamaṃ vātā vāyanti visamā apañjasā.
segments.en: … the blowing of the winds becomes erratic and chaotic.

segments.pli: Visamaṃ vātesu vāyantesu visamesu apañjasesu devatā parikupitā bhavanti.
Devatāsu parikupitāsu devo na sammā dhāraṃ anuppavecchati.
segments.en: … the heavens don’t provide enough rain.

segments.pli: Deve na sammā dhāraṃ anuppavecchante visamapākāni sassāni bhavanti.
Visamapākāni, bhikkhave, sassāni manussā paribhuñjantā appāyukā honti dubbaṇṇā ca bavhābādhā ca.
segments.en: When people eat crops that have ripened erratically, they become short-lived, ugly, weak, and sickly.

segments.pli: Yasmiṃ, bhikkhave, samaye rājāno dhammikā honti, rājāyuttāpi tasmiṃ samaye dhammikā honti.
segments.en: At a time when kings are principled, royal officials become principled.

segments.pli: Rājāyuttesu dhammikesu brāhmaṇagahapatikāpi tasmiṃ samaye dhammikā honti.
Brāhmaṇagahapatikesu dhammikesu negamajānapadāpi tasmiṃ samaye dhammikā honti.
segments.en: people of town and country become principled.
When the people of town and country are principled, the courses of the sun and moon become regular.

segments.pli: Samaṃ candimasūriyesu parivattantesu samaṃ nakkhattāni tārakarūpāni parivattanti.
Samaṃ nakkhattesu tārakarūpesu parivattantesu samaṃ rattindivā parivattanti.
Samaṃ rattindivesu parivattantesu samaṃ māsaddhamāsā parivattanti.
Samaṃ māsaddhamāsesu parivattantesu samaṃ utusaṃvaccharā parivattanti.
segments.en: the seasons and years become regular.

segments.pli: Samaṃ utusaṃvaccharesu parivattantesu samaṃ vātā vāyanti samā pañjasā.
segments.en: … the blowing of the winds becomes regular and orderly.

segments.pli: Samaṃ vātesu vāyantesu samesu pañjasesu devatā aparikupitā bhavanti.
Devatāsu aparikupitāsu devo sammā dhāraṃ anuppavecchati.
segments.en: … the heavens provide plenty of rain.

segments.pli: Deve sammā dhāraṃ anuppavecchante samapākāni sassāni bhavanti.
segments.en: When the heavens provide plenty of rain, the crops ripen well.

segments.pli: Samapākāni, bhikkhave, sassāni manussā paribhuñjantā dīghāyukā ca honti vaṇṇavanto ca balavanto ca appābādhā cāti.
segments.en: When people eat crops that have ripened well, they become long-lived, beautiful, strong, and healthy.
